title: InstrumentTypeEnum
description: Represents an enumeration list to indentify the type of an instrument.

oneOf.title: Certificate
oneOf.description: Identifies an instrument as one that that offers a derivative-based economic return which is not structured as a bond, an equity or a warrant. Note that this security type is not a Certificate of Deposit (aka CD).

oneOf.title: Debt
oneOf.description: Identifies an instrument as a fixed income instrument of debt issued and securitized as a tradable asset.

oneOf.title: Equity
oneOf.description: Identifies an instrument as an Equity value of holding of shares in listed company.

oneOf.title: Fund
oneOf.description: Identifies an instrument as representing holding in an investment fund.

oneOf.title: LetterOfCredit
oneOf.description: Identifies an instrument as a letter of credit or documentary credit/ bankers commercial credit.  A payment mechanism used in international trade to provide economic guarantee of payment by a creditworthy issuer for payment of exported goods.

oneOf.title: ListedDerivative
oneOf.description: Identifies an instrument as a listed derivative on an exchange.

oneOf.title: Warrant
oneOf.description: Identifies an instrument as a Warrant that give the right, but not the obligation, to buy or sell a security — most commonly an equity — at a certain price before expiration, or to receive the cash equivalent.
